```{r}
library(tidyverse)

# A stunning plot exploring diamond price, carat, cut, and color
ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = price, color = cut, size = depth)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.6, shape = 16) +                    # Semi-transparent points
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set2") +                  # Beautiful discrete colors
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(0.5, 3)) +              # Control point size
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format()) + # Dollar format for price
  facet_wrap(~ clarity, ncol = 4) +                       # One panel per clarity
  labs(
    title = "Diamond Prices by Carat, Cut, and Clarity",
    subtitle = "Larger points indicate greater depth | Colors represent cut quality",
    x = "Carat",
    y = "Price (USD)",
    color = "Cut",
    size = "Depth (%)",
    caption = "Data: ggplot2::diamonds"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 20, hjust = 0.5),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(color = "grey50", hjust = 0.5),
    legend.position = "top",
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    panel.border = element_rect(color = "grey80", fill = NA),
    strip.text = element_text(face = "bold", size = 11),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#fafafa", color = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#fafafa", color = NA)
  )

ggsave("beautiful_diamonds.png", width = 14, height = 9, dpi = 300)
```
